intro: Cyrtandra infrafissa, commonly known as the Hawaiian skyflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and has a trailing or climbing growth habit. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra infrafissa is also notable for its role in Hawaiian ecological systems and its historical significance in traditional practices.
